member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions
member.summary: Configuration options for the Durable Task extension.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.DefaultHubName
member.summary: The default task hub name to use when not explicitly configured.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.HubName
member.summary: Gets or sets default task hub name to be used by all , , and instances.
member.remarks: A task hub is a logical grouping of storage resources. Alternate task hub names can be used to isolate multiple Durable Functions applications from each other, even if they are using the same storage backend.
member.value: The name of the default task hub.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.ControlQueueBatchSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of messages to pull from the control queue at a time.
member.remarks: Messages pulled from the control queue are buffered in memory until the internal dispatcher is ready to process them.
member.value: A positive integer configured by the host. The default value is 32.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.PartitionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the partition count for the control queue.
member.remarks: Increasing the number of partitions will increase the number of workers that can concurrently execute orchestrator functions. However, increasing the partition count can also increase the amount of load placed on the storage account and on the thread pool if the number of workers is smaller than the number of partitions.
member.value: A positive integer between 1 and 16. The default value is 4.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.ControlQueueVisibilityTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility timeout of dequeued control queue messages.
member.value: A TimeSpan configured by the host. The default is 5 minutes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.WorkItemQueueVisibilityTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility timeout of dequeued work item queue messages.
member.value: A TimeSpan configured by the host. The default is 5 minutes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.MaxConcurrentActivityFunctions
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of activity functions that can be processed concurrently on a single host instance.
member.remarks: Increasing activity function concurrent can result in increased throughput but can also increase the total CPU and memory usage on a single worker instance.
member.value: A positive integer configured by the host. The default value is 10X the number of processors on the current machine.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.MaxConcurrentOrchestratorFunctions
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of orchestrator functions that can be processed concurrently on a single host instance.
member.value: A positive integer configured by the host. The default value is 10X the number of processors on the current machine.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.AzureStorageConnectionStringName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the Azure Storage connection string used to manage the underlying Azure Storage resources.
member.remarks: If not specified, the default behavior is to use the standard `AzureWebJobsStorage` connection string for all storage usage.
member.value: The name of a connection string that exists in the app's application settings.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.NotificationUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the base URL for the HTTP APIs managed by this extension.
member.remarks: This property is intended for use only by runtime hosts.
member.value: A URL pointing to the hosted function app that responds to status polling requests.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.TraceInputsAndOutputs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to trace the inputs and outputs of function calls.
member.remarks: The default behavior when tracing function execution events is to include the number of bytes in the serialized inputs and outputs for function calls. This provides minimal information about what the inputs and outputs look like without bloating the logs or inadvertently exposing sensitive information to the logs. Setting to true will instead cause the default function logging to log the entire contents of function inputs and outputs.
member.value: true to trace the raw values of inputs and outputs; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.EventGridTopicEndpoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of an Azure Event Grid custom topic endpoint. When set, orchestration life cycle notification events will be automatically published to this endpoint.
member.remarks: Azure Event Grid topic URLs are generally expected to be in the form https://{topic_name}.{region}.eventgrid.azure.net/api/events.
member.value: The Azure Event Grid custom topic URL.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.EventGridKeySettingName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the app setting containing the key used for authenticating with the Azure Event Grid custom topic at .
member.value: The name of the app setting that stores the Azure Event Grid key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.EventGridPublishRetryCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the Event Grid publish request retry count.
member.value: The number of retry attempts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.EventGridPublishRetryInterval
member.summary: Gets orsets the Event Grid publish request retry interval.
member.value: A representing the retry interval. The default value is 5 minutes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.EventGridPublishRetryHttpStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the Event Grid publish request http status.
member.value: A list of HTTP status codes, e.g. 400, 403.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.ExtendedSessionsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether to enable extended sessions.

remarks.para: Extended sessions can improve the performance of orchestrator functions by allowing them to skip replays when new messages are received within short periods of time.

Note that orchestrator functions which are extended this way will continue to count against the limit. To avoid starvation, only half of the maximum number of allowed concurrent orchestrator functions can be concurrently extended at any given time. The property can also be used to control how long an idle orchestrator function is allowed to be extended.
It is recommended that this property be set to false during development to help ensure that the orchestrator code correctly obeys the idempotency rules.

member.value: true to enable extended sessions; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.ExtendedSessionIdleTimeoutInSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time in seconds before an idle session times out. The default value is 30 seconds.
member.remarks: This setting is applicable when is set to true.
member.value: The number of seconds before an idle session times out.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.LogReplayEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets if logs for replay events need to be recorded.
member.remarks: The default value is false, which disables the logging of replay events.
member.value: Boolean value specifying if the replay events should be logged.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationClientBase.CreateCheckStatusResponse(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an HTTP response that is useful for checking the status of the specified instance.
member.remarks: The payload of the returned contains HTTP API URLs that can be used to query the status of the orchestration, raise events to the orchestration, or terminate the orchestration.
member.param: The HTTP request that triggered the current orchestration instance.
The ID of the orchestration instance to check.
member.returns: An HTTP 202 response with a Location header and a payload containing instance control URLs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationClientBase.CreateHttpManagementPayload(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a object that contains status, terminate and send external event HTTP endpoints.
member.param: The ID of the orchestration instance to check.
member.returns: Instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationClientBase.WaitForCompletionOrCreateCheckStatusResponseAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an HTTP response which either contains a payload of management URLs for a non-completed instance or contains the payload containing the output of the completed orchestration.
member.remarks: If the orchestration instance completes within the default 10 second timeout, then the HTTP response payload will contain the output of the orchestration instance formatted as JSON. However, if the orchestration does not complete within this timeout, then the HTTP response will be identical to that of the API.
member.param: The HTTP request that triggered the current function.
The unique ID of the instance to check.
member.returns: An HTTP response which may include a 202 and location header or a 200 with the durable function output in the response body.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationClientBase.WaitForCompletionOrCreateCheckStatusResponseAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates an HTTP response which either contains a payload of management URLs for a non-completed instance or contains the payload containing the output of the completed orchestration.
member.remarks: If the orchestration instance completes within the specified timeout, then the HTTP response payload will contain the output of the orchestration instance formatted as JSON. However, if the orchestration does not complete within the specified timeout, then the HTTP response will be identical to that of the API.
member.param: The HTTP request that triggered the current function.
The unique ID of the instance to check.
Total allowed timeout for output from the durable function. The default value is 10 seconds.
member.returns: An HTTP response which may include a 202 and location header or a 200 with the durable function output in the response body.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationClientBase.WaitForCompletionOrCreateCheckStatusResponseAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates an HTTP response which either contains a payload of management URLs for a non-completed instance or contains the payload containing the output of the completed orchestration.
member.remarks: If the orchestration instance completes within the specified timeout, then the HTTP response payload will contain the output of the orchestration instance formatted as JSON. However, if the orchestration does not complete within the specified timeout, then the HTTP response will be identical to that of the API.
member.param: The HTTP request that triggered the current function.
The unique ID of the instance to check.
Total allowed timeout for output from the durable function. The default value is 10 seconds.
The timeout between checks for output from the durable function. The default value is 1 second.
member.returns: An HTTP response which may include a 202 and location header or a 200 with the durable function output in the response body.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationClientBase.RaiseEventAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends an event notification message to a waiting orchestration instance.

remarks.para: In order to handle the event, the target orchestration instance must be waiting for an event named using the API.
If the specified instance is not found or not running, this operation will have no effect.

member.param: The ID of the orchestration instance that will handle the event.
The name of the event.
member.returns: A task that completes when the event notification message has been enqueued.

member.param: The ID of the orchestration instance that will handle the event.
The name of the event.
The JSON-serializeable data associated with the event.
member.returns: A task that completes when the event notification message has been enqueued.

member.summary: Terminates a running orchestration instance.

member.returns: Returns a task which completes when the purge has completed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationClientBase.GetStatusAsync(System.DateTime,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationRuntimeStatus},System.Int32,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets the status of all orchestration instances with paging that match the specified conditions.
member.remarks: This is limited to and it will not be published to external clients.
member.param: Return orchestration instances which were created after this DateTime.
Return orchestration instances which were created before this DateTime.
Return orchestration instances which matches the runtimeStatus.
Number of records per one request.
ContinuationToken of the pager.
Cancellation token that can be used to cancel the status query operation.
member.returns: Returns each page of orchestration status for all instances and continuation token of next page.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContext
member.summary: Parameter data for orchestration bindings that can be used to schedule function-based activities.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContext.GetRawInput
member.summary: Returns the orchestrator function input as a raw JSON string value.
member.returns: The raw JSON-formatted orchestrator function input.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContext.GetInputAsJson
member.summary: Gets the input of the current orchestrator function instance as a JToken.
member.returns: The parsed JToken representation of the orchestrator function input.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContext.SetOutput(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the JSON-serializeable output of the current orchestrator function.
member.remarks: If this method is not called explicitly, the return value of the orchestrator function is used as the output.
member.param: The JSON-serializeable value to use as the orchestrator function output.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContext.CreateTimer``1(System.DateTime,``0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a durable timer that expires at a specified time.
member.remarks: All durable timers created using this method must either expire or be cancelled using the before the orchestrator function completes. Otherwise the underlying framework will keep the instance alive until the timer expires.
member.param: The time at which the timer should expire.
Any state to be preserved by the timer.
The CancellationToken to use for cancelling the timer.
member.returns: A durable task that completes when the durable timer expires.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase
member.summary: Abstract base class for .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase.InstanceId
member.summary: Gets the instance ID of the currently executing orchestration.
member.remarks: The instance ID is generated and fixed when the orchestrator function is scheduled. It can be either auto-generated, in which case it is formatted as a GUID, or it can be user-specified with any format.
member.value: The ID of the current orchestration instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase.ParentInstanceId
member.summary: Gets the parent instance ID of the currently executing sub-orchestration.
member.remarks: The parent instance ID is generated and fixed when the parent orchestrator function is scheduled. It can be either auto-generated, in which case it is formatted as a GUID, or it can be user-specified with any format.
member.value: The ID of the parent orchestration of the current sub-orchestration instance. The value will be available only in sub-orchestrations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase.CurrentUtcDateTime
member.summary: Gets the current date/time in a way that is safe for use by orchestrator functions.
member.remarks: This date/time value is derived from the orchestration history. It always returns the same value at specific points in the orchestrator function code, making it deterministic and safe for replay.
member.value: The orchestration's current date/time in UTC.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase.IsReplaying
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the orchestrator function is currently replaying itself.
member.remarks: This property is useful when there is logic that needs to run only when the orchestrator function is *not* replaying. For example, certain types of application logging may become too noisy when duplicated as part of orchestrator function replay. The orchestrator code could check to see whether the function is being replayed and then issue the log statements when this value is false.
member.value: true if the orchestrator function is currently being replayed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase.GetInput``1
member.summary: Gets the input of the current orchestrator function as a deserialized value.
member.typeparam: Any data contract type that matches the JSON input.
member.returns: The deserialized input value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase.NewGuid
member.summary: Creates a new GUID that is safe for replay within an orchestrator function.
member.remarks: The default implementation of this method creates a name-based UUID using the algorithm from RFC 4122 4.3. The name input used to generate this value is a combination of the orchestration instance ID and an internally managed sequence number.
member.returns: The new value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase.CallActivityAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Schedules an activity function named for execution.
member.param: The name of the activity function to call.
The JSON-serializeable input to pass to the activity function.
member.returns: A durable task that completes when the called function completes or fails.
member.exception: The specified function does not exist, is disabled, or is not an orchestrator function.
The current thread is different than the thread which started the orchestrator execution.
The activity function failed with an unhandled exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase.WaitForExternalEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Waits asynchronously for an event to be raised with name .
member.remarks: External clients can raise events to a waiting orchestration instance using with the object parameter set to null.
member.param: The name of the event to wait for.
member.returns: A durable task that completes when the external event is received.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase.WaitForExternalEvent``1(System.String)
member.summary: Waits asynchronously for an event to be raised with name and returns the event data.
member.remarks: External clients can raise events to a waiting orchestration instance using .
member.param: The name of the event to wait for.
member.typeparam: Any serializeable type that represents the JSON event payload.
member.returns: A durable task that completes when the external event is received.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase.WaitForExternalEvent(System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits asynchronously for an event to be raised with name .
member.remarks: External clients can raise events to a waiting orchestration instance using with the object parameter set to null.
member.param: The name of the event to wait for.
The duration after which to throw a TimeoutException.
member.returns: A durable task that completes when the external event is received.
member.exception: The external event was not received before the timeout expired.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase.WaitForExternalEvent``1(System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits asynchronously for an event to be raised with name and returns the event data.

member.param: The name of the event to wait for.
The duration after which to throw a TimeoutException.
member.typeparam: Any serializeable type that represents the JSON event payload.
member.returns: A durable task that completes when the external event is received.
member.exception: The external event was not received before the timeout expired.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase.WaitForExternalEvent``1(System.String,System.TimeSpan,``0)
member.summary: Waits asynchronously for an event to be raised with name and returns the event data.
member.remarks: External clients can raise events to a waiting orchestration instance using .
member.param: The name of the event to wait for.
The duration after which to return the value in the parameter.
The default value to return if the timeout expires before the external event is received.
member.typeparam: Any serializeable type that represents the JSON event payload.
member.returns: A durable task that completes when the external event is received, or returns the value of if the timeout expires.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase.ContinueAsNew(System.Object)
member.summary: Restarts the orchestration by clearing its history.

remarks.para: Large orchestration histories can consume a lot of memory and cause delays in instance load times. This method can be used to periodically truncate the stored history of an orchestration instance.
Note that any unprocessed external events will be discarded when an orchestration instance restarts itself using this method.

member.param: The JSON-serializeable data to re-initialize the instance with.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationContextBase.SetCustomStatus(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the JSON-serializeable status of the current orchestrator function.
member.remarks: The value is serialized to JSON and will be made available to the orchestration status query APIs. The serialized JSON value must not exceed 16 KB of UTF-16 encoded text.
member.param: The JSON-serializeable value to use as the orchestrator function's custom status.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationStatus
member.summary: Represents the status of a durable orchestration instance.
member.remarks: An external client can fetch the status of an orchestration instance using .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationStatus.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the queried orchestrator function.
member.value: The orchestrator function name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationStatus.InstanceId
member.summary: Gets the ID of the queried orchestration instance.
member.remarks: The instance ID is generated and fixed when the orchestrator function is scheduled. It can be either auto-generated, in which case it is formatted as a GUID, or it can be user-specified with any format.
member.value: The unique ID of the instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationStatus.CreatedTime
member.summary: Gets the time at which the orchestration instance was created.
member.remarks: If the orchestration instance is in the status, this time represents the time at which the orchestration instance was scheduled.
member.value: The instance creation time in UTC.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationStatus.LastUpdatedTime
member.summary: Gets the time at which the orchestration instance last updated its execution history.
member.value: The last-updated time in UTC.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationStatus.Input
member.summary: Gets the input of the orchestrator function instance.
member.value: The input as either a JToken or null if no input was provided.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationStatus.Output
member.summary: Gets the output of the queried orchestration instance.
member.value: The output as either a JToken object or null if it has not yet completed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationStatus.RuntimeStatus
member.summary: Gets the runtime status of the queried orchestration instance.
member.value: Expected values include `Running`, `Pending`, `Failed`, `Canceled`, `Terminated`, `Completed`.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationStatus.CustomStatus
member.summary: Gets the custom status payload (if any) that was set by the orchestrator function.
member.remarks: Orchestrator functions can set a custom status using .
member.value: The custom status as either a JToken object or null if no custom status has been set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableOrchestrationStatus.History
member.summary: Gets the execution history of the orchestration instance.
member.remarks: The history log can be large and is therefore null by default. It is populated only when explicitly requested in the call to .
member.value: The output as a JArray object or null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.FunctionFailedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a sub-orchestrator or activity function fails with an error.
member.remarks: The `InnerException` property of this instance will contain additional information about the failed sub-orchestrator or activity function.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationClientAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to bind a function parameter to a instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationClientAttribute.TaskHub
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the name of the task hub in which the orchestration data lives.
member.value: The task hub used by this binding.
member.remarks: The default behavior is to use the task hub name specified in . If no value exists there, then a default value will be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationClientAttribute.ConnectionName
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the name of the Azure Storage connection string used by this binding.
member.value: The name of a connection string that exists in the app's application settings.
member.remarks: The default behavior is to use the value specified in . If no value exists there, then the default behavior is to use the standard `AzureWebJobsStorage` connection string for all storage usage.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationClientAttribute.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code for this attribute.
member.returns: A hash code for this attribute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationClientAttribute.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares two instances for value equality.
member.param: The object to compare with.
member.returns: true if the two attributes have the same configuration; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationClientAttribute.Equals(Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationClientAttribute)
member.summary: Compares two instances for value equality.
member.param: The object to compare with.
member.returns: true if the two attributes have the same configuration; otherwise false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationRuntimeStatus
member.summary: Represents the possible runtime execution status values for an orchestration instance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationRuntimeStatus.Running
member.summary: The orchestration is running (it may be actively running or waiting for input).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationRuntimeStatus.Completed
member.summary: The orchestration ran to completion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationRuntimeStatus.ContinuedAsNew
member.summary: The orchestration completed with ContinueAsNew as is in the process of restarting.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationRuntimeStatus.Failed
member.summary: The orchestration failed with an error.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationRuntimeStatus.Canceled
member.summary: The orchestration was canceled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationRuntimeStatus.Terminated
member.summary: The orchestration was terminated via an API call.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationRuntimeStatus.Pending
member.summary: The orchestration was scheduled but has not yet started.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationTriggerAttribute
member.summary: Trigger attribute used for durable orchestrator functions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.OrchestrationTriggerAttribute.Orchestration
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the orchestrator function.
member.remarks: If not specified, the function name is used as the name of the orchestration.
member.value: The name of the orchestrator function or null to use the function name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.RetryOptions
member.summary: Defines retry policies that can be passed as parameters to various operations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.RetryOptions.#ctor(System.TimeSpan,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance RetryOptions with the supplied first retry and max attempts.
member.param: Timespan to wait for the first retry.
Max number of attempts to retry.
member.exception: The value must be greater than .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.RetryOptions.FirstRetryInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the first retry interval.
member.value: The TimeSpan to wait for the first retries.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.RetryOptions.MaxRetryInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the max retry interval.
member.value: The TimeSpan of the max retry interval, defaults to .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.RetryOptions.BackoffCoefficient
member.summary: Gets or sets the backoff coefficient.
member.value: The backoff coefficient used to determine rate of increase of backoff. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.RetryOptions.RetryTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout for retries.
member.value: The TimeSpan timeout for retries, defaults to .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.RetryOptions.MaxNumberOfAttempts
member.summary: Gets or sets the max number of attempts.
member.value: The maximum number of retry attempts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.RetryOptions.Handle
member.summary: Gets or sets a delegate to call on exception to determine if retries should proceed.
member.value: The delegate to handle exception to determie if retries should proceed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.StartOrchestrationArgs.FunctionName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the orchestrator function to start.
member.value: The name of the orchestrator function to start.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.StartOrchestrationArgs.InstanceId
member.summary: Gets or sets the instance ID to assign to the started orchestration.
member.remarks: If this property value is null (the default), then a randomly generated instance ID will be assigned automatically.
member.value: The instance ID to assign.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.StartOrchestrationArgs.Input
member.summary: Gets or sets the JSON-serializeable input data for the orchestrator function.
member.value: JSON-serializeable input value for the orchestrator function.
